Detailed Description

This class declares an interface for receiving reply messages.

When a client issues a request, an interface of this type should be provided to handle the reply.

See also:
Bundle::startRequest

Bundle::startReply

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Mercury::ReplyMessageHandler::handleException ( const NubException &  exception,
void *  arg 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called by Mercury when the request fails.

The normal reason for this happening is a timeout.

Parameters:
exception The reason for failure.
arg The user-defined data associated with the request.

Implemented in ProbeReplyHandler, Mercury::BlockingReplyHandler, and RetryingRequest.

virtual void Mercury::ReplyMessageHandler::handleMessage ( const Address &  source,
UnpackedMessageHeader &  header,
BinaryIStream &  data,
void *  arg 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called by Mercury to deliver a reply message.

Parameters:
source The address at which the message originated.
header This contains the message type, size, and flags.
data The actual message data.
arg This is user-defined data that was passed in with the request that generated this reply.

Implemented in ProbeReplyHandler, Mercury::BlockingReplyHandler, and RetryingRequest.
